code.displayName: Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:patient with C/O mild abdominal pain for 5 weeks that is frequent. pt also reports mild cramping, mild nausea. patient is a white F aged 36 years. o:Height 66 in, Weight 117 lbs, Temperature 98.2 F, Pulse 87, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 16, all lung fields, Abdomen = mild epigastric tenderness, distension, no hepatomegaly a:Irritable Bowel p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed amitriptyline - 50 mg daily, and ordered CBC.

content2.Unmatched: pt also reports mild cramping , mild

td.content: s:patient presents with 7 weeks history of mild abdominal pain, mild nausea and mild cramping. she is a white f aged 37 ys. o:Height 67 in, Weight 118 lbs, Temperature 97.8 F, Pulse 80, SystolicBP 109, DiastolicBP 69, Respiration 16, all lung fields, Abdomen = mild epigastric tenderness, distension, no hepatomegaly a:Irritable Bowel p:performed E/M Level 3 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed amitriptyline - 50 mg daily, and ordered CBC.
